_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Texas Processing, LLC - Corpus Christi was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) #58 (2014 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is this facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact the Corpus Christi Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) as well as the Corpus Christi Fire Department, as appropriate, through the 911 Service. Medical emergencies will require notification of Corpus Christi Medical Center. This facility maintains a trained incipient stage fire response and first-responder operations level hazardous materials response team to respond to the initial stages of an emergency. 



The Corpus Christi facility is a refined petroleum product storage and distribution facility. The Risk Management Program (RMP) covers the LPG distribution and storage system only, including the associated piping and twenty-four (24) 90,000 gallon storage tanks, and 3 truck loading/offloading stations.



This Worst Case and Alternate Case release scenarios were evaluated and communicated to the Corpus Christi Fire Department. Additionally, the local Emergency Response Action Plan was updated to reflect the addition of liquefied propane and butane.



The Corpus Christi Facility complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D-Program Level 3).  Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor - Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations inclusive of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).



This Facility has never had an accident involving the Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage system resulting in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in-plac

e.



In the event of an emergency involving the Corpus Christi Facility LPG Storage system, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Corpus Christi Fire Department and request their assistance.  The Facility's Emergency Response Action Plan is coordinated with the Corpus Christi Fire Department and the Corpus Christi LEPC.  The Facility is fully secured with fencing and controlled access in accordance with its site security plan.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety. As such, a global operating procedure and maintenance program is being developed. Also, Buckeye is implementing a corporate-wide policy to include the local first responders in regular exercises and in all 3 year PSM/RMP training cycles.
